note: Seed registry. Expand freely (code-independent). Prefer museum collection pages and public-domain/IIIF images.

items.name: Vincent van Gogh
items.why_significant: Major figure in modern painting; influential use of color and brushwork.

items.name: Claude Monet
items.why_significant: Key Impressionist; series-based studies of light and atmosphere.

items.name: Edgar Degas
items.why_significant: Innovative composition and depiction of movement; ballet and modern life.

items.name: Mary Cassatt
items.why_significant: Prominent American Impressionist; intimate domestic scenes and printmaking.

items.name: Katsushika Hokusai
items.why_significant: Influential Japanese printmaker; major impact on global visual culture.

items.name: Pablo Picasso
items.why_significant: Revolutionized modern art; co-developed Cubism and transformed 20th‑century visual language.

items.name: Henri Matisse
items.why_significant: Leader of Fauvism; influential color and form innovations across painting and cut-outs.

items.name: Paul Cézanne
items.why_significant: Bridged Impressionism and Cubism; major influence on structure and composition in modern art.

items.name: Gustav Klimt
items.why_significant: Key Secession figure; decorative symbolism and iconic portraiture influenced European modernism.

items.name: Jackson Pollock
items.why_significant: Pioneered drip technique and action painting; pivotal in postwar American art.

items.name: Frida Kahlo
items.why_significant: Distinctive self-portraiture exploring identity and politics; global cultural impact.

items.name: Georgia O’Keeffe
items.why_significant: Major American modernist; iconic large-scale florals and landscapes.
